Using GDB we can quickly solve this challenge. Disassembling the main function and using â€˜x/sâ€™ on one of the string addresses will show us the string â€œcrackmes4ever:)â€. Giving that will show us a â€œCorrectâ€ message. We are then asked to provide a pin to the program. In the disassembly of the test function we can find a â€œstrlenâ€ call with a comparison with 0xf immediately after. The content of the pin is not examined, only the length of it, so any combination of characters that is equal to 15 is correct. The length should be 15 and not 16 because the newline character at the end is also considered.
